page.title: 02BADDESLEY COLLIERY.
page.content: Baddesley Colliery lies in the northern area of the Warwickshire coalfield.The extent of the coalfield is approximately 32km.long from Tamworth in the north to Coventry in the south,although bore holes have proved there is a considerable extension to the south of Daw Mill, Coventry.At its widest extremity around the Atherstone area it extends to a width of 13km. The colliery's output is 6000,000 tonnes per year produced from four production units all fully mechanised with powered supports and face end mechanisation. Coal has been mined in the Baddesley area since the 15th.Century and on the present site since 1850.During the first 100 years the colliery produced high quality two yard coal,but at the present time coal is being produced from four narrower seams.
